amendment.description: An amendment numbered 18 and printed in the Congressional record that stipulates that foreign states or agencies are not immune to U.S.property seizure or expropriation laws.

action.text: Mr. Obey raised a point of order against the Saxton amendment (A011). Mr. Obey stated that the provisions of the Saxton amendment constitute legislation on an appropriations bill. The Chair sustained the point of order.
